section.name: Use Cases
section.p: This page contains an overview of all use cases. Use cases are listed with a discriptive title and link to the full use case description. Every use case is identified by an unique identifier using the following syntax: [UC-<Number>]
Note: Since we don't yet need full use cases, a preliminary list of use cases without an identifier will suffice. Identifiers are added later on.

section.name: Use Case Description
section.subsection:
Summary Navigate through the shared files.
Rationale The user wants to view the files belonging to the project. He may do so hierarchically or by the help of tags.
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user indicates that the application is to show the datapool and its contents
Exceptions
Alternative paths
Postconditions All objects in the project are displayed by their name in their hierarchical order
Frequency of use 5
Priority 5
Open issues

Summary The user creates a new note.
Rationale Key feature.
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user indicates to create a new note
The user enters the text of the note
The user indicates to save the note
The note is stored in the application.
Exceptions In 3.: If the user indicates to cancel the operation, no note will be created
Alternative paths
Postconditions A new note is created and the application is returned to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary The User adds a file into a project folder.
Rationale The User wants to share some of his files with the other members of the project.
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user indicates that he/she wants to add a file to the project.
A list of possible files from the users file system is presented.
The User selects a file or a folder and indicates to add this file/folder.
The file/folder is added to the project datapool.
Exceptions In 3.: if the user indicates to cancel the operation, no note will be created
Frequency of use 2
Priority 3
Open issues
This use case was: import file/folder; we don't necessarily want to implement dragging an folder in user should do that in the explorer? When talking about folders, isn't that use case to share an existing folder as a new project?
Alternative paths (4). If the file is already in the project datapool, the user gets a warning.
Postconditions
The specified file is in the datapool.
The application returns to its previous state.

Summary View a note
Rationale Key feature
Preconditions
[ST-02]
at least one note exists in the project
Course of Events
The user selects a note from the project an indicates to view it.
The note is displayed in an editable form
The user may change the content of the note
The user indicates to save the changes
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 4.: If the user indicates to cancel the operation, no changes are made to the note.
Postconditions The changes are performed to the note, and the application returns to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary The user has the ability to manage the tags associated to an JakeObject.
Rationale Key feature.
Preconditions
[ST-02]
The object to be tagged exists in the project
Course of Events
The user select an object from the project and indicates to change the objects tags
All existing tags of that object is presented, and the user may add, change or delete tags
The user indicates to save the changes
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 3.: If the user indicates to cancel the operation, no change will be performed.
Postconditions The changes are stored, the application returns to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary The user selects an object from the datapool and indicates to remove it.
Rationale The user wants to remove objects from the project root.
Preconditions
[ST-02]
at least one object exists in the project
Course of Events
The user selects an objects from the datapool.
The user indicates that he/she wants to delete the object.
The user is prompted if he/she really wants to delete the objects.
The objects are removed from the datapool.
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 1. the user may select multiple objects.
In 3. the user may cancel the operation.
In 4. if the object cannot be deleted from the project the user will be notified.
Postconditions The object is deleted from the project, the application return to its previous state
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues
Propagation of change: A LogEntry with the action "delete" is added. The other users may or may not be asked to accept the change (maybe a preference setting).
Maybe we should exclude the deletion of multiple objects. Saves implementation, and getting asked more than once isn't a bad idea. If the user wants to mass-delete files, he/she can still do that in the file system and we will get every deletion.

Summary Synchronizing the data of the project with other clients
Rationale Key feature.
Preconditions
[ST-02]
The client is connected to at least one other client
Course of Events
The user indicates to synchronize the project
The application synchronizes the information, which JakeObjects are new or have changed, etc.
Exceptions In 2. if an error occurs, the user is prompted with an error message.
In 2. if a version conflict occurs the application assists the user to resolve the conflict. see [???]
Alternative paths The project is synchronized, the application returns to its previous state
Postconditions
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary The user may set the "synchronization mode" preference for the project to perform push automatically or manually. The user may also choose to perform pull automatically or manually.
Rationale Manual push/pull reduces the amount of bandwidth needed and gives the user more control over the traffic.
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user selects one object from the project and indicates to change the synchronization mode
The user may choose between manual or auto
The user indicates to safe the changes
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 3.: The user may cancel the operation. No changes are stored
Postconditions The synchronization mode is set for the object, the application returns to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary The user wants to open a file with an external application
Rationale Since Jake does not support editing data, there must be a way to open data in an external application.
Preconditions
[ST-02]
at least one file must exist in the project
The operating system supports a method of launching the application associated with a file
Course of Events
The user indicates to open an object in an external application.
The operating system is told to call an external application for editing the file.
Exceptions
Alternative paths An error may occur during the process. In that case the user is prompted with an error message.
Postconditions The object is opened in an external application, the application returns to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

subsection.name: [UC-01:10] Find object by name or tag

section.subsection:
Summary List all objects with a certain tag
Rationale Finding JakeObjects either by name or tag
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user indicates he wants to perform a search.
The user enters a search term
The user may choose to only search for matching filenames, or tags, or both
The user indicates to perform the search
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 4. the user may cancel the operation, the application returns to its previous state
Postconditions All matching JakeObjects in the project are listed so that the user can access them.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary Display all the project members that are associated with the project.
Rationale User wants to know who works on the project, and who access to the data.
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user indicates to view all project members
Exceptions
Alternative paths The user may indicate to only display members that are currently online.
Postconditions All project members are listed in alphabetical order by their name and online status. For those who are online, it is displayed whether the project is in synch or not (e.g if the local and remote project are in the same state)
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

subsection.name: [UC-02:03] Search users by ID (in the network, e.g. XMPP or else)

section.subsection:
Summary Search for users in the network by their ID. That may be via the XMPP protocol and service, or some other network
Rationale Finding users is crucial.
Preconditions [ST-02] or the application is in the state of the postcondition of this UC
Course of Events
The user indicates to search for other users
The user enters a user ID
The user indicates to perform the search
Exceptions
Alternative paths
Postconditions All matching users are listed in alphabetical oder by their ID and name (name, first-name)
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues
We can not implement this for XMPP and it is a additional feature that is just "nice to have". We can only check if a userid exists. That is nearly the use case of inviting others.
Request for removal.

subsection.name: [UC-02:04] Invite a user to join the project

section.subsection:
Summary Invite new users to join the project
Rationale A project needs project members. Connecting them can be made easier by invitations.
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
User A has the userid of user B, and indicates he wants to invite him
User A is prompted that an invitation was sent to the new user.
User B is prompted to confirm the invitation.
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 2. the user may cancel the operation, the application returns to its previous state
In 3. if an error occurs, the error message is shown to the user.
Postconditions An invitation is sent to the new user, the application returns to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Summary The users accepts a project invitation
Rationale A project needs project members. Connecting them can be made easier by invitations.
Preconditions
[ST-01]
at least one pending invitation
Course of Events
A pending invitation is shown to the user with the date of issuing and the identity of the sender.
The user accepts the invitation
The user is prompted to chose a local location for the project folder
The user is asked if he/she wants to synchronize the project data
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 3. the user may reject the invitation. The invitation is rejected and the application returns to its previous state.
In 4. if an error occurs creating the project folder the error message is displayed.
In 5. the user may choose not to synchronize the project.
Postconditions
The user is added to the project
A project folder is created
The new project is loaded
The project data is synchronized (if chosen)
The application returns to state [ST-02]
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues

Request for urgent removal.
Summary The user may change his/her personal metadata
Rationale The user needs to provide more personal metadata than his/her sole User-ID
Preconditions [ST-02]
Course of Events
The user indicates to change his/her personal metadata
The user may change various metadata
The user indicates to safe the changes
Exceptions
Alternative paths In 3. if the user cancels the operation no data will be changed. The application returns to its previous state.
Postconditions The changes are saved, the application returns to its previous state.
Frequency of use
Priority
Open issues Request for urgent removal. It is a additional feature. We only show project members meta data. The editing of the metadata has to happen externally. Too much effort.
With XMPP for example, the user enters the vcard once in has chat client.
